snippet: The federal jury that convicted Mr. Tsarnaev last month in the Boston Marathon bombing rejected the defense’s case that his brother, Tamerlan, had held a malevolent sway over him and had led him to commit the crimes.
abstract: Federal jury sentences Dzokhar Tsarnaev to death for his role in 2013 Boston Marathon bombings; Tsarnaev reveals no emotion as verdict is read; reaction of victims is mostly subdued; jury rejected defense argument that Tsarnaev's older brother Tamerlan was primarily responsible and thus he did not deserve capital punishment.

byline.contributor: Alexandra Odynova and Andrew Roth contributed reporting from Moscow.

lead_paragraph: The federal jury that convicted Mr. Tsarnaev last month in the Boston Marathon bombing rejected the defense’s case that his brother, Tamerlan, had held a malevolent sway over him and had led him to commit the crimes.

headline.main: Dzhokhar Tsarnaev Given Death Penalty in Boston Marathon Bombing
headline.print_headline: Tsarnaev Given Death Sentence in Boston Attack
